bibl.title: Letter from Mazyck P. Ravenel to Jefferson Randolph Kean, October 27, 1925

div1.p: Ravenel comments on factual errors in the Russell article about Gorgas' sanitation work.

div1.head: Letter from Mazyck P. Ravenel to Jefferson Randolph Kean, October 27, 1925
div1.opener:
BACTECNOLOGY AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
UNIVERSITY OF MISSOURI
COLUMBIA
October 27, 1925.
Colonel J. R. Kean,
Seventh and B. Streets, S.W.,
Washington, D. C.
My dear Colonel Kean:
div1.p:
I had been hoping to hear of your interview
with F. F. Russell. I sent to you a copy of the Sigma Zi Quart-
erly containing Russell's address, and I hope you will note the
several inaccuracies, some of which I pointed out to you.

I have just been looking over Gorgas's book,
“Sanitation in Panama”. Gorgas himself says that the Americans
arrived in Havana in December, 1898. Yellow fever was considered
a filth disease and the military authorities concluded that this
was the opportunity which the United States had been waiting for
the past two hundred years. Energetic and capable army officers
were placed at the head of various municipal departments, and by the
middle of 1900 were perfectly organized and were accomplishing all
that was possible. The city was cleaned as well as it was possible
to clean it. Yellow fever patients were isolated and the health
regulations of the Sanitary Department were thoroughly and carefully
carried out. In spite of this yellow fever had been steadily growing
worse every since the Americans had taken possession of the city, and
in 1900 there were a greater number of cases than there had been for
several years. The cleanest and best kept portions of the city were
the worst sufferers from yellow fever, and the Cubans twitted the Ameri-
cans over the uselessness of their work, claiming that they had made
things worse instead of better. It is curious in view of the abundant
testimony there is on this subject that Dr. Russell should have made
Colonel J. R. Kean,
Page 2.
such blunders, and further I consider it inexcusable.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, Mazyck P. Ravenel, M. D. MPR:LP
